website_summaries.verdict: While pricey, this dentist-recommended toothbrush is highly effective. Owners say they wouldn't want to go without it.
pros: Includes two-minute timer and three levels of intensity for a thorough and customized cleaning session
Effective at whitening and removing plaque
cons: Occasional complaints about the durability of the toothbrush

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly poor reliability
customer_reviews.text: This thing is GREAT at cleaning your teeth, but has the longevity of a corn flake. I've owned the top of the range Diamond (18 month life then dead) and now this (8 month life now dead). There's a pattern developing here. Move on to OralB.
customer_reviews.author: Cratered

customer_reviews.title: I don't usually write reviews, but felt I had ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write reviews, but felt I had to comment on this product. This is the second Phillips Sonicare toothbrush I purchased. I guess I thought they may have improved over the years. Wrong! The first one I bought only recharged for a little under a year. This second one, was purchased in November, so lasted a little under 7 months. Sorry, but when I spend $80 on a toothbrush, I expect a little more. In the interim 2 1/2 years between the 2 Phillips products, I had a Water Pik toothbrush which lasted the entire 2 1/2 years and did the job just as well and cost less. I will be going back to the Water Pik.
customer_reviews.author: stwill

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: The product works well at first but stopped working after about 6 months. Customer support was good enough to send me a replacement but after 2 years the toothbrush started suddenly turning on all by itself and I couldn't turn it off. Then I couldn't charge it. I was able to charge it but it repeated all its problems. I now see there are other reviews describing similar problems. For the cost, one expects to have a product with a long life.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: No Longer High Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tooth brush 21 months ago. After about 18 months it started losing power. It feels like the brushes are not spinning and vibrating the way they used to. It took about ten years for this to happen to the last Sonicare toothbrush I bought. I can see needing to replace it after ten years. Not after one and a half. The quality and value has gone out of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Pepper Elf

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only a short time.................
customer_reviews.text: After a very short amount of time this product will not charge. It is clumsy to operate and obviously poor , no very poor quality with a faulty design. I am very upset because I shopped a long time to choose this one for a husband who already has Dementia and needed something easy to handle. I feel like sending it back just so they can have it for themselves. I am very surprised that the maker of Sonicare sell this product. How about an explanation or better still give me back my money Dorothy
customer_reviews.author: Miss Dorothy Chage my rating to a two star

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I brought this two years ago and loved it until a few days ago. My teeth feel so much cleaner with an electric toothbrush, and I like this model better than the basic Sonicare one, which my husband has. Unfortunately, the toothbrush has stopped working/ is haunted. It will turn off in the middle of brushing, and then randomly turn on in the middle of the night. I'll probably buy another version of this model, but I'm bummed it didn't last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Alex L

customer_reviews.title: I love my Sonicare and have been using one for 10 ...
customer_reviews.text: I love my Sonicare and have been using one for 10 years. Like many other will tell you, you’ll never feel clean again just using a normal toothbrush. After recently losing one on a trip (left at the hotel), I purchased a replacement on Amazon at a rediculoisly low price! Although I love the toothbrush, this particular model is missing some features that I miss on the original one I replaced. Mainly it’s missing a battery indicator on the handle (hence the low price) which the more expensive models come with. Although the light flashes to let you know you’re low, I miss knowing when I’m down to 2/3rds battery etc.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Sarkissian

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a upgraded model for 5 years,it's still working great. I decided to order a new one, needless to say i was very dissatisfied! I don't like dealing with returns but I actually only used it once and it doesn't work. So I am still using my 5 year old model.
customer_reviews.author: Angela celaya

customer_reviews.title: I just came from an OralB toothbrush and I prefer Sonicare.
customer_reviews.text: You can get more details about the device from other reviewers so I'll just add that, since I just came from an OralB toothbrush, I prefer Sonicare. Compared with OralB the Sonicare is more refined, quieter and has Lithium vs NiCd battery. My OralB battery was losing juice quickly after only 9 months or so but it was really the loudness of the device which drove me to look at Sonicare more closely. Now that I have one it's clearly the better toothbrush and worth the extra $$ compared w similar OralB models..
customer_reviews.author: SixtyFourTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Product fell apart after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I expect these toothbrushes to last more than 5 months. First discussion with Philips is that they would not honour their warranty so not impressed. Dropped from 4 star to 1 star. My preference is the Philips over the Oral B toothbrush. The pack comes with a nice travel case. There are three different levels for different strength of cleaning. Replacement heads are expensive so try to do a good maintenance of the brush and the main body tends to fail in a couple years so users need to assess if it is worth the replacement cost. My first model died in 2 years and the second died a few months after.
customer_reviews.author: hsk

customer_reviews.title: Not a keeper
customer_reviews.text: The nicest thing I can say about this product is that it holds a charge very well. Charge lasts about a month. The toothbrush itself is ineffectual, and hideously LOUD. After three months, it's going directly into the trash!
customer_reviews.author: DeeDee9

customer_reviews.title: Nice electric toothbrush with travel case, but only comes with 1 brush head
customer_reviews.text: Like the simple and small base, and the additional travel carrying case that comes with this unit. It comes with only 1 brush head, but clearly the reseller took out the other 2 brush heads from the manufacturer packaging as the plastic is moulded in the shape of the brush heads in 3 spots. Leaves a little bit of a bad taste in your mouth, but the 1 diamond brush head provided can help with that. Really like that the brush heads don't have any holes/slits that like the oral-b brush heads do, so no collecting gunk. Not a huge fan of the vibration rather than rotating like oral-b, but not a deal breaker.
customer_reviews.author: R. Spiky

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last a year!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Philips Sonicare, and it does cleans really well when it works. Both Sonicare brushes had the exact same problem. The problem is the area where you attach the tooth brush head to the power stick. To begin with it's quiet and after less than a year it's more like using a jackhammer with the teeth jarring vibration. Perhaps Philips needs to invest more on a quality product with better quality control than just asking for a high price and substandard product. Not impressed and will be going back to a Braun toothbrush as they know how to make a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really felt a difference
customer_reviews.text: I have been told to get one of these for years. I didnt see much use it is just a toothbrush. WRONG, imediatley by the second brushing i felt a difference. I have timed two minutes before, and I used the same toothpaste as usual. I felt a less slipery sensation when I touched my tongue to my teeth, my gums did not bleed as much as usual. I will add another review in a month or two. I really would try this inexpensive brand for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The brush comes off the base when you are brushing ...
customer_reviews.text: The brush comes off the base when you are brushing. I have to hold it with my index finger while brushing. I was very surprised because I've owned a Sonicare before and this was not the case. I can't believe the quality isn't what it used to be.
customer_reviews.author: StealthTX

customer_reviews.title: Man I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Man I love this thing! What a superior product. The Sonicare line was recommended by my dentist and I choice this one because it has a noticeably extensive battery life once fully charged. Also, I like that you can control the intensity level on this model. It does have that advertised quadpacer technology to let you know when to move to the next quadrant of your mouth. I definitely notice that my teeth feel much cleaner when compared to a manual toothbrush or even other [inferior] sonic toothbrushes. Amazon had a great price and the shipping was FAST. Would recommend this product over and over again. 10 out 10
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: The Same, Yet Different
customer_reviews.text: The same, yet different. That's how my wife describes her new Sonicare toothbrush. There were a few functions she asked, "Why can't they just leave it alone?". Other than the base being smaller with no UV cleaner, a thumbswitch (which tends to break down over the years) to select mode and a solid distinguishing band instead of the earlier removable bands to indicate ownership, this is basically the same toothbrush Philips Sonicare has produced with great results.
customer_reviews.author: By CJs Pirate

customer_reviews.title: Broke within a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in July of 2018, It broke in October 2019- I was traveling for work from June-August of 2019, so I didn't even use it for a whole year. However, Philips was very accommodating and replaced it. Then in March of 2019, the one they had replaced broke AGAIN! (Broke meaning, it just doesn't turn on) So they sent me ANOTHER replacement. Basically, don't buy this if you don't want to worry about replacing it, but Philips has been very helpful and accommodating.
customer_reviews.author: nicolemarie

customer_reviews.title: ... this toothbrush for about a month now and it's great. It is a bit cheaper because it's an ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this toothbrush for about a month now and it's great. It is a bit cheaper because it's an older model. I got mine for like $80 with tax from one of the third party sellers which was fulfilled by Amazon. It was new in packaging and works great. My teeth have never been cleaner and the timer on the toothbrush is great. I haven't had any of the issues that some people giving one or two star reviews are saying they have. I will update if I do have issues.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Zhu

customer_reviews.title: Great toothbrush, not sure how long it should last- mine lasted 4 1/2 years
customer_reviews.text: It was a great toothbrush. Mine lasted for 4 1/2 years. I guess I should consider myself lucky after reading the reviews about it dying on others after only a few months. I am considering purchasing another, but it's awful you can't just replace the battery, and that the whole product will end up in a landfill.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable cleaning capabilities!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to put my Oral-B electric toothbrush out to pasture, and invest in a new Philips SoniCare HealthyWhite+. I have been using it for about 2 months now, and BOY do I notice a difference. This toothbrush took me a few days to get used to...it vibrates at an extremely high rate. But now that I am used to it, I love it! My dental hygienist noticed a difference in the amount of plaque within 3 weeks of using it. It came with a travel case, which I adore. I won't be switching any time soon!
customer_reviews.author: Che

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and Strong
customer_reviews.text: I have experienced several different kinds of electric tooth brushes, this one by far, is my favorite. It is quiet, strong, and my teeth feel clean when done. I do feel their brush cycle is too short, shuts off before I am ready, but I don't mind turning it back on. I saw a noticeable difference in my boyfriends teeth, which is a great bonus. They are whiter, and I feel like he brushes his teeth more often.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah W

customer_reviews.title: Battery challenges
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful tooth care product. My teeth and gums are healthier than ever after using for two plus years! However the products have battery problems. My first product's battery went bad in less than a year. Philips replaced it, noting that is would not guarantee the product past the original date. Then it went out again, so I ordered a new one. I discovered that the old one that I thought went bad was fine using the new charger. So all I really needed to replace was the old charger. I now have two good units with one good charger.
customer_reviews.author: Fain Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was a good decision. the Philips Sonicare electric toothbrush really cleans my teeth deep and the two-minute timer with zone reminders is very useful for a even, clean brush on all parts of my teeth. I do wish there were more buttons for different modes instead of having to repeatedly press the power button or hold it down for "x" amount of time. Haven't really seen a different in terms of "whitening" affects, but only used it for a couple weeks now.
customer_reviews.author: tianx038

customer_reviews.title: This is not made to last
customer_reviews.text: I loved this while I had it. It did a terrific job and pleased my dentist. Bought it less than two years ago and it's already hesitating, becoming irregular, showing signs of dying. My previous one lasted for more like seven years (still not a thrill) and died because I dropped it. I am incredibly disappointed that I have to spend another $100 not even two years later because it just isn't made to last.
customer_reviews.author: lidlone

customer_reviews.title: Like the Sonicare, not their replacement brush pricing.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as replacement for previous Sonicare unit that failed after 5 years daily use. Hope this one lasts as long. If OEM replacement brushes were reasonably priced it would have gotten 5 stars. There seems to be a strong similarity between Phillips replacement brush pricing strategy and that for replacement printer ink.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Kerkling

customer_reviews.title: Broke one month after it was purchased
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tooth brush one month ago. My fiancé got me a similar one last year but 9 months later I noticed that once I put pressure on the bristles to my teeth the vibration became very weak. This is exactly what happened to this toothbrush ONE MONTH after I got it. I will be returning this toothbrush and never buying Phillips sonicare again.
customer_reviews.author: lynn

customer_reviews.title: Sonicare is back again..
customer_reviews.text: This is SO much better than my last Sonicare which lasted just over a year. Two years ago bought one of the cheap models and it was terrible and the brush failed to vibrate after only 6 months without messing around with it every time. I was ready to give up on Sonicare which I had used for more than 10 years.. Now I have this model and it seems good just like the first one I had 11-12 years ago. Time will tell, but this one seems better built, powerful and good battery life.
customer_reviews.author: D. Vogel

customer_reviews.title: Lasted Only 22 months!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say anything bad about Sonicare toothbrushes....while they work. The problem is they're not designed to last. This is my third Sonicare and they all died after approx. two years. This last time I thought maybe it was a specific model that was the problem, so I bought a different model. It made no difference. It still died. I can't justify spending $100 on a toothbrush that doesn't even last two years.
customer_reviews.author: aws6241

customer_reviews.title: Wow, what happened!
customer_reviews.text: I started using this and was amazed at how well it cleaned my teeth. It felt like I just came home from the dentist.....that it....while it still worked. I bet I got 6 - 7 months until this brush stopped working. It still turns on and runs, but most of the time the brush doesn't vibrate at all. It just makes noise. I am going to write Philips, but until then - look elsewhere!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Shortage in the brush
customer_reviews.text: This toothbrush worked great for about 6 months... A few months in I had charging issues, but that worked itself out. However, last month, about a week into a new toothbrush head, more issues began. My toothbrush must have a shortage of some kind because the vibration is horrible and doesn’t really clean my teeth anymore. I tried longer charges, changing the head again, taking the brush off and cleaning underneath more frequently. Nothing works and my electric toothbrush is essentially the same as a free brush from the dentist.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi Stoller

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good, with one drawback
customer_reviews.text: I've used Sonicare toothbrushes for several years because I believe they do an excellent job of keeping my teeth as clean, white and healthy as possible. Of all the models I've owned, this is probably my least favorite because it is too easy to inadvertently turn the power off and/or change the intensity setting while brushing. It's not a huge deal but is enough of a nuisance to take off one star.
customer_reviews.author: Vannor

customer_reviews.title: Definite Improvement Over The Old Model
customer_reviews.text: In December 2014 I bought a Philips Sonicare HX6731/02 Healthywhite Rechargeable Electric Toothbrush which just broke. I loved it so I bought this, the updated model. This model is a definite improvement over the old one. It's much lighter, comes out of the base easier, requires less button pushing, and works just as well as the old one. I think it was even cheaper! My old supply of extra heads fits this one as well. I'm very pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ritch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, excellent for travel.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift. The recipient was so pleased that I bought another for myself. It is very effective and helped me crate a better brushing regimen. The charge lasts a very long time. That fact, coupled with the carry case, makes this a very convenient option for extended travel. I also opted for their brand toothpaste---I am glad that I did because it has a thicker consistency that my typical over-the-counter toothpaste. I recommend some kind of thicker paste or gel because it stays better on the brush.
customer_reviews.author: chrisinpa

customer_reviews.title: Love it but broke too early
customer_reviews.text: Great product, but it broke in less than a month. Right after I could not return it too. So I worked with Phillips and they sent me another one free of charge but still no answers to why it broke in the first place. I didn’t over use it or anything. Just weird.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality -do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I have own Sonicare electric toothbrushes for many years now and used to love them. However, I purchased my last one in May 2018, and now it no longer works. I followed all instructions regarding caring and cleaning, and I also only bought the name brand heads for replacement. I am very disappointed as my previous Sonicare lasted many years. Likely to purchase Oral-B next.
customer_reviews.author: Whatdoineedtodonow

customer_reviews.title: Broken within 10 months.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased same toothbrush twice. The first one was broken within 10 months and second in only 6 months. Same problem being unable to recharge. Warranty instructions are unclear. I think they should take more responsibility toward customers and our environment by producing better products that don't become trash in a matter of months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a mess.
customer_reviews.text: My dentist wanted me to use this toothbrush. I’ve had it for several weeks. I do think it cleans more thoroughly. I haven’t used the whitening option enough to know if it helps. What I hate...even though I only use a small amount of toothpaste, it creates a real mess not only in the sink, but down the handle of the brush. I dread tooth brushing now because of the cleanup. Surely there’s an ergonomic design that would work better!
customer_reviews.author: Emily's Library

customer_reviews.title: Love love love!
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting this toothbrush for a while now and finally got it on prime day. I'm in love! My teeth are so clean. The brush is easy to use and change modes but I havent been able to turn on some of the other features like the beep when it begins charging. It's not that big of deal for me though. The whole thing is pretty big/long so it probably wouldn't be the best for children. I love that the bristle part is small, it makes it easy to get to harder to reach places.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Terebieniec

customer_reviews.title: Died Just after a year. It stopped working and ...
customer_reviews.text: Died Just after a year. It stopped working and beeped 5 times when I tried to turn it on. Then dead. The LEDs aren't doing anything. Putting it back on the charger doesn't help. Will see how the warranty works. Update: Called in warranty and a week later received a replacement in the mail. Included label to ship old one back. Can't tell if new or refurbished - serial number starts with 1709 so might be old. Either way at least it is working. Will see how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Not all sonicare are created equal- Found out the hard way, but this version is great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Sonicare to replace a lower price point Sonicare that I bought only a month ago. The first one was the 50.00 price range, and it barely functioned, if you tried to get more pressure, the bristles would just stop moving, although fully charged. I bought this one at twice the price to replace the bad one, and am happy to say this one is fantastic, strong pressure, clean teeth. I think Sonicare shouldn't even be offering the sub-par version, as a non- electric toothbrush would work as well or better. Shame on Sonicare, for even having crappy products in their arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: lilygracecaroline

customer_reviews.title: Wow. My mouth is doing well now!
customer_reviews.text: I hate brushing my teeth and as an adult I know that’s strange. But I hate it. And bc of that hate, my teeth have suffered. Dentist suggestion & I finally got it on prime day 2019. It’s literally how I got my prime account (I just never needed amazon until I realized that I DID need it after prime day). Now my teeth are much cleaner! Also I charged it twice in a year. The battery life is insanely good. It’s expensive but so worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Deondra

customer_reviews.title: Cuts out during use
customer_reviews.text: I may have received a defective item. Although it has had plenty of time to charge, it “cuts out” while I’m trying to use it. Last one started doing that after several years of use, so I replaced with this model. These are not cheap, so I am not pleased. I have had several over the years, all worked perfectly. So I threw out the packaging. Guess that will teach me!
customer_reviews.author: pmoonreid

customer_reviews.title: Brush no longer worked effectively after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Would've given it 5 stars but it start to work only if the toothbrush head was pulled out a little bit after 3 months of use. I changed the brush head, and I continued to have this problem. Now it's been a year and my toothbrush no longer will charge and when I attempt to charge it, it continuously vibrates two short spurts then one long vibrate. It won't work anymore and I tried to dry it out by putting it in rice but that didn't work either. I really like the toothbrush....when it work correctly in the first 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Lycette

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long?
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful yet gentle cleaning; I like the different speeds/modes. My teeth have never felt so clean, and seem whiter when used with a whitening toothpaste. Massages gums - feels nice and gums aren’t receding like did with regular brush. Easy to travel with using provided case. Get extra brush heads and share with spouse, or kids can share.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy A.

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I should have always been using an electric toothbrush; felt like my teeth had been professionally cleaned and polished after the first use. Cold sensitivity is almost completely gone as well. After two weeks of use it appears to be a well made product. Everyone should be using one of these.
customer_reviews.author: DMav

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t Last
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this toothbrush while it lasted. At just under two years it stopped holding a charge. It sits on the charger and repeatedly buzzes(1 long buzz, 2 short buzzes) for hours. It will work for maybe half a brush cycle then is dead. Based on other reviews, this seems to be a common problem. Price seems high for less than 2 years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi C.

customer_reviews.title: Best Toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: This really is the Best Toothbrush. I previously owned a Oral B Electric Toothbrush and it doesn't clean my teeth anywhere as well as the Sonicare. When I brush with the Sonicare my teeth are all smooth and look great. When I use the Oral B my teeth would feel fuzzy.
customer_reviews.author: Beth CochranTop Contributor: Fashion Design

customer_reviews.title: BEST TOOTHBRUSH I'VE EVER OWNED!
customer_reviews.text: My Sonicare Essence toothbrush died after 5 years and I decided to upgrade to the Healthy White model. I'm SO glad I did! My cheaper Essence model collected a lot of grime easily and the Healthy White model does not because it has an all-over tighter construction. I also like that you can control the level of brushing power. My teeth and gums are very clean and healthy. I recently had my first professional teeth cleaning in 3 years recently and the dentist complimented both my gums and the whiteness of my teeth. Amazon had a competitive price well below the Big Box Electronic Store. I would not hesitate to buy this model again.
customer_reviews.author: KY Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Broke quickly
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to give this five stars, but in just a few short months one of the modes stopped working. My window for having this problem ddressed appears to have closed. So basically, when it worked it worked great and the remaining modes work great but the mode I lost was my preferred one.😕
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Item defective after 2 months of use
customer_reviews.text: Brush started making unpleasant, loud, erratic noises, and vibrating oddly after only <60 days of gentle use. Amazon did not provide any support, because 30 day return window had passed. I do not think this is a genuine Philips item, as everybody I have spoke to before purchase, highly recommended this toothbrush. Will not buy electronic products on AMZN again. Buyer be aware!
customer_reviews.author: Martin Gross

customer_reviews.title: Best toothbrush I have had!
customer_reviews.text: I love this toothbrush. I have been using this product for over 6 years. I got my first one after I was having trouble keeping my teeth cleaned due to braces and drinking lots of coffee. I didnt go to my dentist for 1 year and I had zero cavities and no plaque build up. I uses my first toothbrush for over 2 years before I lost it. My 2nd one started doing alot of noises so I replaced it. I would recommend buying the extended warranty.
customer_reviews.author: BLANCA M

customer_reviews.title: How did I live without this?
customer_reviews.text: Literally don't know how I ever survived without an electric toothbrush. I used my manual one to take a trip and found serious regret! This is hands down one of my best purchases. It even does a different little buzz to tell you it's time to move to a different part of your mouth
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: 3 weeks in
customer_reviews.text: Case doesn't hold or close, so forget travel or storing. Extremely disappointing, especially with a traveling profession. Quick charging, but dies in a few uses, not that you should brush your teeth for a whole hour. Cleans deeper than a standard brush, only owned for 3 weeks. I'm 50/50 on it, expectations were too high for this.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Richards

customer_reviews.title: Best electric toothbrush I've tried...
customer_reviews.text: Having owned both Sonicare and Waterpik electric toothbrushes, I have to say that this one is hands down the best. For years, I have been unsatisfied with plaque remaining after brushing in what appear to be grooved areas of my front teeth, but have not found any brush that would remove it- until now. This brush does a great job!
customer_reviews.author: Austen Fan

customer_reviews.title: My shiny teeth and me
customer_reviews.text: What can I say. It’s a Phillips sonicare. You know what it’s for. You heard the hype. You’re here looking at reviews with bad breath. You need one. Everybody does. Just buy it already the product works great that’s why they’re known. Now hurry and brush your teeth with this amazing toothbrush.
customer_reviews.author: BrandonS.

customer_reviews.title: the button is super sensitive (which results in accidentally turning it off pretty ...
customer_reviews.text: Sonicare has definitely changed the quality of their product. This one feels cheap, the button is super sensitive (which results in accidentally turning it off pretty much every time I brush my teeth) and the brush heads do not snap all the way in place. I do like that it came with a travel case and it does function how it's supposed to. When I'm ready for a new one I will likely purchase it from a brick and mortar store for quality control. Updating my review to add that my toothbrush started to malfunction right around the 2 year mark, which is the length of the warranty I believe.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this 6 weeks and the toothbrush will not stay attached to the base.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than 20 months
customer_reviews.text: Overall I was happy with this toothbrush for it's working lifespan - though I can't say the whitening feature was particularly effective. My issue is that it died in well under two years (writing this in April 2020 and purchased in August 2018) - started making a very loud noise and not vibrating/cleaning effectively.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Found the perfect toothbrush!
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted an electric toothbrush & had heard that Sonicare was the way to go. This is honestly one of the best purchases I have ever made. Easy to use, cleans my teeth well, and vibrations fell like its massaging my mouth (which I find relaxing). I've also noticed that my teeth are getting whiter. My favorite part is that the toothbrush has different intensity settings to choose from, so I put it in a low setting for my sensitive gums. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo H. Santacruz

customer_reviews.title: Sonicare hits all the marks...and does well for my gums!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Sonicare. Since I've begun using this toothbrush I've had the BEST dentist visits. I hear more and more that my gums are doing well and that my teeth are healthy. I attribute a lot of this feedback to Sonicare. Prior to using this brush I had a lot of gum bleeding. I'm very grateful that I've found something to help. I even purchased one for my mother. She said she'll never go back to a regular brush again.
customer_reviews.author: STL Possum

customer_reviews.title: Worthless toothbrush head
customer_reviews.text: I love the toothbrush, but hate the fact than less than a month later the diamondclean toothbrush head that comes with it is damaged. This toothbrush head is so expensive and I cannot believe that in less than a month a piece of it falls (a metallic ring). See pic for reference . This is not the first time I have issues with the "original" tootbrush heads from phillips
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Noticeable Improvement
customer_reviews.text: I love this toothbrush! I notice a difference after using this toothbrush. My mouth feels cleaner and I’ve noticed an improvement with morning breath. I feel like this toothbrush will last me a long time and I love the travel case it comes with.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic brush, came with defective brush head
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic toothbrush. I took "before " and "after " pictures of my teeth to see if they would be whiter after ten days, and The pictures do show a difference. Additionally, my gums are less sensitive. For years I've needed novacain just to have my teeth cleaned. Today I went for a cleaning and had no gum sensitivity at all, with no Novocain. I'm giving only 4 stars, as the brush head that came with, just falls off when the tooth brush is started. Fortunately I ordered replacement brush heads, and the one I'm now using stays attached.
customer_reviews.author: Lucia

customer_reviews.title: big fan
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to spend so much on a tooth brush, but my dentist recommended it. Totally worth it! My teeth felt amazing & such a deep clean! It took a bit to get used to, especially at higher levels, but i dont see myself going back to manual brushes.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing reliability or a fluke?
customer_reviews.text: After 8 months, oil started leaking from the handle where the brush attaches. Over the following two months the motor sounded more and more labored. Fearing the worst I replaced it with model HX 6631. This is the first time over the years a Sonicare brush failed so quickly. Given the price, I expected more.
customer_reviews.author: TimWool

customer_reviews.title: My teeth feel clean again!
customer_reviews.text: My old sonicare died a few days ago so I ordered this one as a replacement. It arrived same day as promised. Although the instructions say to charge for 48 hours, the toothbrush arrived with enough charge for me to use it right away. I did NOT like that Sonicare has eliminated the stand feature that allows you to keep two brush heads available (useful if you and your spouse use the same Sonicare with separate brush heads) - but luckily the stand from my old charger snapped off and fit perfectly on the new one. Hooray!
customer_reviews.author: Nora

customer_reviews.title: Great toothbrush, if it wasnt broken
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Nov 2016, so about 1.5 years ago. My essence had stopped charging so this was an upgrade and I do feel it provided better cleaning. About a month ago, however, it stopped working. Not sure what's wrong with it, but the replacement heads (sonicare brand) do not snap quite right so the vibration doesn't work properly. I bought this toothbrush for $79, so I'm surprised it's now being sold for $97. The essence is still pretty good in comparison, but that one also broke after a year (stopped charging). I might just have bad luck, but not sure I want to spend this much on a toothbrush annually when I already have to buy the replacement heads
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality clean - Quiet!
customer_reviews.text: I've had the same Sonicare for years, but the new brushes weren't working as well so I decided to get a new one. This new Sonicare is the BEST! So quiet and the travel case is great. Battery lasts for weeks and I feel like I'm getting a much deeper clean. This was a great decision on my part and I highly recommend this Sonicare.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Moran

customer_reviews.title: Brush Heads Disconnect While Brushing
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these based on past performance of an older set which would no longer take a charge. Other than basic brushing we haven’t used any of the “features”. Our reoccurring problem is this brush head keeps disconnecting while we are brushing. Very irritating. Definitely the last Phillips Toothbrush we will ever buy. Just unbelievable. Sure these were not some defective clearance deal as some have suggested. We did purchase them on the annual Amazon Day.
customer_reviews.author: Lester Lamberson

customer_reviews.title: Wish this held up longer
customer_reviews.text: I have loved this toothbrush but am dismayed that after two years it has started to fail. Still under warranty, it’s been a struggle to get Phillips to replace the handle, and for that reason I’m giving this four stars.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it
customer_reviews.text: You will feel the difference after a while that you use it. Especially if you feel lazy at night to brush your teeth properly. You can buy an extra head and use it with your Partner. I colored the end of the heads with nail paint 😁. There is a case that makes it easy to use when you are traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Habib

customer_reviews.title: good choice
customer_reviews.text: Making the switch from a regular toothbrush to an electric one for better cleaning. This seems to be a good choice. Is comfortable in my mouth and I like the timer. Am using this on the most gentle cycle at the moment, but it seems to do the job Don't care about whitening, b so didn't rate it
customer_reviews.author: J. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: My Oral B electric toothbrush finally broke (RIP) this summer after 11 years, and I was devastated. That toothbrush and I had been through so much together. A regular brush just wasn't the same. Bought this on Prime Day and have not been disappointed. The charge lasts for months (I've charged it twice since I received it in July, and one of those was the out-of-the-box charging). The lowest setting is all you need; I thought my teeth would rattle out of my head on the highest setting.
customer_reviews.author: Siobhan

customer_reviews.title: It Was Good While It Lasted
customer_reviews.text: This toothbrush made my teeth feel great - like I'd just been at the dentist. I bought two and one is still working fine. The other just recently stopped working: The motor is running, but the toothbrush head no longer vibrates to clean teeth. It's not even been a year since purchase. I didn't do anything unusual to the toothbrush, but did change the head several times. This shouldn't cause it to break, but I suspect that's what happened. Waiting to see how long the second toothbrush lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Liebhardt

customer_reviews.title: defective item
customer_reviews.text: item broke after a month, was outside of return window. amazon refused to replace it. Beware! defective items sent. sounds like a lawn mower and brush head doesnt move.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Can't get better
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a Christmas gift for my girlfriend over two years ago. It gets used every day and goes everywhere she does. Still holds an incredible amount of charge for an absurd amount of time (over a month. between charges)! I'll hopefully be buying one for myself soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Pins

customer_reviews.title: ... my old Philips electric tooth brush which was probably better than 8 years old at this point
customer_reviews.text: Just got this a few days ago to replace my old Philips electric tooth brush which was probably better than 8 years old at this point. This new one is pretty great, thought that the head was small at first, but then upon brushing it really does it's job. It has a couple of settings, I find the lowest one pretty good. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Customer J

customer_reviews.title: Love the toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: My previous one died a few months ago. I didn't realize how much better my teeth and gums feel with this toothbrush until going without one and using a manual TB, but wow what a difference. Totally worth the $$.
customer_reviews.author: Hollybadger

customer_reviews.title: Hurts your teeth
customer_reviews.text: This thing was like a high frequency jackhammer attacking your teeth. If you have sensitive teeth, avoid this thing. I sent it back
customer_reviews.author: 54fytng

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: I am actually surprised at how much whiter my teeth are now that I have been using this toothbrush for a while. It also feels great on my teeth - lots of vibrations! I turn off the motor when I brush my tongue because it sprays toothpaste everywhere if I don't plus it is a little intense for my tongue. Haha. I do really like the results!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: I love this toothbrush.. long lasting charge.. 3 speeds and turns off after perfect amount of time.. makes me brush longer than if I was using a regular toothbrush.. definitely improved my teeth Coker and lessens the friction on my gums from being too rough with a standard toothbrush .. comes with nice carrying case for travel
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Solid for a Litlle While
customer_reviews.text: Worked fairly well for 1 year, but stopped vibrating making it worthless. 1st sonicare toothbrush worked several years but upgraded to this and its dead after 1 year of use. I dont bv recommend as it's not quality.
customer_reviews.author: Cara S.

customer_reviews.title: crap after 2 months... twice.
customer_reviews.text: really like this. I had another unit (different brand) that finally died after many years, and this was a great replacement. Edit: I had this for a few months, then it started getting really loud and rough. I contacted Sonicare, and they sent me out a new one. Unfortunately, this one did the same thing after a couple months as well. Really disappointed and frustrated with the poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: MTC

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE MY Sonicare Toothbrush !!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. this is my second electric toothbrush. Not only does it clean your teeth very well and helps whiten them, but my dentist said that this toothbrush has helped tighten my loose teeth that happened from Periodontal Disease caused from smoking cigarettes. I have quit the cigarettes back in 2007 and by using this toothbrush and having my teeth cleaned 4x a year, my teeth are no longer loose. The dentist said that my teeth have recovered almost 100%.
customer_reviews.author: heidi

customer_reviews.title: Great toothbrush!
customer_reviews.text: I have a history of having a cavity or two at most dental checkups. I have had no cavities at the last 2 dental checkups since using this toorbrush! I attribute this to the tootbrush.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Quality issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine just two years ago, and it has needed to be replaced TWICE. Something is off with the manufacturing of these, in my opinion. After about. A year or regular use, the handle stops vibrating with the same power as it originally did, and gets really loud. Had it replaced once with the warranty for free, but had to jump through lots of hoops with Philips, and it just broke again this week. I’ll be buying a different brand from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Evan Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I got the Sonicare HealthyWhite+ at the recommendation of the dental website Animated-Teeth.com (see their report "Which Is the Best Sonicare Toothbrush?") Amazon gave me a very nice discount on the purchase. The carrying case included with the toothbrush is a nice extra. I'm giving this toothbrush four stars at present because I've never gotten more than three years use out of any Sonicare model in the past - so this one is on probation, you might say, and hopefully it will beat the average. So far (after three weeks) I like what I see. Just consider this an investment in periodontal health.
customer_reviews.author: Medium John

customer_reviews.title: Your teeth will love you
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so when you first fire this up, you'll think...whoa, odd sensation, not sure if I like this. When you finish brushing and feel your teeth, wow! Feels like your teeth just got cleaned by the dentist. Yes, really, that good.
customer_reviews.author: Hampton**

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Philips to die!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd one in a row that has died. I purchased this in March, 2018 and it should have lasted longer than 1 year! The battery died on the first one and now the power button wont work on this one. It turns on and off whenever it wants to! I'm never spending this much money on a toothbrush again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael & Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: This version of the Sonicare is a major upgrade from my 3 series Plaque Removal brush. That brush had a gap between the brush head and the base of the brush. The 3 series also had a very loud buzzing sound when in your mouth. I’m happy to report that the HealthyWhite+ delivers on no gap between brush head and base, AND has a very quite nature about it. I got it on PrimeDay for 70% off, so at the time, this was a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: Replaceable brush heads fall off!!
customer_reviews.text: I like the overall toothbrush and it’s option for whitening, however I’m disappointed in the removable brush heads... I took mine off to travel and now it won’t stay on the toothbrush when I try to put it back on. I can hold it on while brushing, though it’s a major hassle & it’s almost fallen down the sink three times because the vibrations shoot it off. Not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Your dentist will love you!
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my old Sonicare and this one is so much better! Love the three speeds for whitening. It’s easy to clean and a must have. My teeth feel so clean and I always get a good report from my dentist.
customer_reviews.author: Joelle Coyle

customer_reviews.title: As advertised.  Your teeth will love you.
customer_reviews.text: It's another world. And didn't have to spend mega bucks to get Sonicare. Wished I had invested in it sooner. Oral-B convert.
customer_reviews.author: lovemovies

customer_reviews.title: Great Electric Toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: This is the best electric toothbrush at a reasonable price. It is amazing how clean one's teeth feel after using just one time. The charger is small and does not take up much space on the vanity. The included travel case is a nice bonus.
customer_reviews.author: t

customer_reviews.title: Where has this been my whole life?!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness, this is a lifechanger! My husband and I have had these only 3 days and our teeth are already visibly whiter, and feel SO clean! I can’t believe how quickly we have seen results! I love the quad spacer timer, makes it mindless to get an even brush. I just wish you could change modes without actually turning on the toothbrush. That is my only complaint. Such a happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: MaKenna

customer_reviews.title: Did not last!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had this less than two years and it died already would not recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: italianmama

customer_reviews.title: Loose brush head after 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: Brush head became loose at two years. The only way to fix it is to break the seal in the bottom and tighten a screw inside. Complete ripoff and poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Singletary

customer_reviews.title: Toothbrush handle
customer_reviews.text: I love all the options and features this toothbrush has. The only thing I really don't like is that it is too slick to get a good grip on it. My old Sonicare toothbrush has a rubber back to the handle. That way it didn't slip out of your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Charly

customer_reviews.title: Great toothbrush!
customer_reviews.text: Great toothbrush! Got this one for my aunt. She voiced interest when she saw that the whole family was using them. Gotta love the travel case too!!
customer_reviews.author: KellyO

product_meta.title: Philips Sonicare HealthyWhite+ Rechargeable Electric Toothbrush, White HX8911/02
product_meta.description: Color:WhiteEverybody loves a bright white smile. Safely brighten your smile every day without giving up the foods and drinks you love The Philips Sonicare HealthyWhite+ rechargeable electric toothbrush is proven to remove up to 100 percent more stains for whiter teeth in only 1 week versus a manual toothbrush. The White mode removes surface stains, brightens and polishes. The DiamondClean whitening brush head removes up to 7x more plaque than a manual toothbrush. On top of that, this toothbrush contains 3 intensity settings for maximum comfort, a 2 minute timer to assure dental professional recommended brushing time, and the QuadPacer a 30 second interval timer that indicates when you need to move to the next quadrant of your mouth for a thorough clean.
feature_bullets: Safely brighten your smile by removing up to 100 percentage more stains in only 1 week vs a manual toothbrush
Gently remove up to 7x more plaque from hard to reach areas better than a manual toothbrush for an optimal clean
Personalize your brushing experience with 3 intensities and 2 modes: Clean and White proven to remove everyday stains such as coffee, tea, tobacco and red wine
Our QuadPacer lets you know when you've spent just the right amount of time cleaning each part of your mouth, while our Smartimer tells you when you've brushed for the recommended 2 minutes
Provides a superior clean through advanced sonic technology that gently creates microbubbles that reach deep between teeth and along the gumline

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
